data.title: Arthur Conan Doyle, First Edition, Signed
data.meta_description: Ethay Adventureyay ofyay Ackblay Eterpay by Oyleday, Irsay Arthuryay Onancay (Doyle, Arthur Conan) and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: Fine. First edition. Wrappers Copy number 52 of an edition limited to 60 The Adventure of the Black Peter translated into pig latin! For pig latin as a second language readers only. Signed by the translator Evinkay Eedray. Signed by Author(s).

Broadside [31 cm x 20 cm] Fine. Keepsake printed for the first meeting of the Utah Bibliographical Society. Printed on Crane Letra paper by Robert Buchert at the Tryst Press and designed by Travis Low. Broadside features an illustration by Bernard Partridge of Sherlock Holmes chained to Arthur Conan Doyle, who has his head in the clouds. Signed by Michael W. Homer at the foot. Printed in an edition of 100 copies.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition; First Printing. Signed by author on title page and he wrote a quote from page 160 at top of title page. First edition, first printing. Hard cover published by Forge Books in 2003. Dark blue covers with silver lettering on spine. Bottom corners are slightly bumped. Bottom of rear endpaper has a note written by the prior owner about how the book was signed. Book is in very good condition. Dust jacket is in a protective mylar cover and is in very good condition. Large 8vo, 464 pages, 1.8 lb.; Large 8vo 9" - 10" tall; 464 pages; Signed by Author.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. First Edition. 24mo - over 5" - 5¾" tall. Copy # Z of only 26 hand-lettered hardcover copies signed by author. Printed letterpress by hand by John Ruyle at Pequod Press. Hand-bound in cloth by the printer, paper spine label. A nice copy, as issued, appearing never read. Another of the entertaining and witty 'Turlock Loams' parodies of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's legendary detective Sherlock Holmes, authored and printed by John Ruyle. Ruyle's private press - the Pequod Press - issued numerous Sherlockian and other titles for over thirty years.

Cloth. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. None (illustrator). First Edition. SIGNED by the Author, 8vo, brown cloth with gold lettering on spine & gold rules bordering the cover, Mylar-protected pictorial full-color dust jacket (unclipped), illustrated by Don Bolognese and Elaine Raphael with several full-page B&W drawings, 287 pages. A story of espionage in World War I as related by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (1859-1930): "Transmitted from beyond the grave, here is the long-suppressed chronicle of Conan Doyle's 1917 espionage mission into wartime Germany, to track down an awesome new weapon designed to destroy England and end World War I with a German victory. Sir Arthur's account of this adventure is told with an engaging Irish wit that will delight even his most fervent admirers."--jacket. Characters include Dr. Albert Einstein, Lenin, and Somerset Maugham. Exceptional overall condition! Clean, bright, tight with No remainder marks.

Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. First Edition, First Printing. First printing. Like new, mint condition throughout in original dust jacket with a protective cover installed. Book is clean, tight and square throughout and is signed and dated (November 17, 2001) on the title page by the Editor, the self-styled "Rediscoverer", Hines. Not a common Doyle book but a good one. Hardcover in green paper boards and black cloth spine.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. First Edition. 24mo - over 5" - 5¾" tall. Copy # QQ of only 52 hand-lettered hardcover copies signed by author. Printed letterpress by hand by John Ruyle at Pequod Press. Hand-bound in cloth by the printer, paper spine label. A nice copy, as issued, appearing never read. Another of the entertaining and witty 'Turlock Loams' parodies of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's legendary detective Sherlock Holmes, authored and printed by John Ruyle. Ruyle's private press - the Pequod Press - issued numerous Sherlockian and other titles for over thirty years.

Soft cover. Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First impression of this Graphic novel edition from 2010 in fine condition, signed by adaptor and illustrator to title page no markings, pages clean, binding firm, no jacket as issued, please see pics, PayPal accepted, any questions please get in touch. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. First Edition. 24mo - over 5" - 5¾" tall. Copy # Z of only 26 hand-lettered hardcover copies signed by author. Printed letterpress by hand by John Ruyle at Pequod Press. Hand-bound in cloth by the printer, paper spine label. A nice copy, as issued, appearing never read. Ruyle's private press - the Pequod Press - issued numerous Sherlockian and other titles for over thirty years.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. First Edition. 32mo - over 4" - 5" tall. Copy #Z of 26 hand-lettered hardcover copies signed by the author. Printed letterpress by hand by John Ruyle at Pequod Press. Hand-bound in cloth by the printer, paper spine label. A nice copy, as issued, appearing never read. Ruyle's private press - the Pequod Press - issued numerous Sherlockian and other titles for over thirty years.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. First Edition. 32mo - over 4" - 5" tall. Copy #V of 26 hand-lettered hardcover copies signed by the author. Printed letterpress by hand by John Ruyle at Pequod Press. Hand-bound in cloth by the printer, paper spine label. A nice copy, as issued, appearing never read. Ruyle's private press - the Pequod Press - issued numerous Sherlockian and other titles for over thirty years.

Soft cover. 1st Edition. 1st Edition. Soft cover. Signed by Author(s). First Edition Signed and dated in 1974 by the illustrater Rob Pudim on the half-title. A fine copy in decorated stiff card wrappers, as issued. Small 8vo. 36 pp. Limited to 500 copies. Five Sherlockian sketches that originally appeared in Punch in t he 1930's.

Soft cover. 1st Edition. 1st Edition. Soft cover. Signed by Author(s). First Edition Signed by the illustrater Rob Pudim and the editors, Tom and Enid Schantz on the half-title. A fine copy in decorated stiff card wrappers, as issued. Small 8vo. 40 pp. Limited to 500 copies. Superb Sherlockian and Philo Vance parodies that originally appeared in the 1910's and 1920's.

INSCRIBED, DATED, AND SIGNED BY THE EDITOR. Extended subtitle: "Further Notices, Minutes and Memoranda of the BSI's Buttons-cum-Commissionaire, together with Irregular Correspondence, Contemporary Newspaper and Magazine Reports, Personal Reminiscences, Original Research, Stories for Which the World Is Finally Prepared, Financial Reports of The BSI, Incorporated, Extracts from the Final Issues of the Original Series Baker Street Journal, Photographs and Other Illustrations, and Running Editorial Commentary." First edition (as stated upon copyright page). [12], 508 pages. Paperback: H 21.5cm x L 13.75cm. Red paper covers; slender white streak to rear cover. Editor's six-line ink inscription "for Ralph Earle . . . Jon Lellenberg . . . 1/26/00" on title page (the inscribee being Ambassador Ralph Earle II). Interior pages are otherwise bright and clean. Binding remains fairly crisp. Still a fine copy. Laid-in at rear (as part of the publication) are two folding sheets featuring photographs of the January 1949 and January 1950 BSI dinners with keys identifying the attendees. ISBN 096487881X.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: No Dustjacket. First Edition. ISBN . B094SXTJD1 Hardback. No dustjacket. First printing from September 1982 as stated on the copyright page. Inscribed by the author to the previous owner on the first page in, Otherwise book is a Tight sound unmarked copy in Near Fine condition. Tight Bright attractive copy with no markings to the book, Tight bright attractive copy with no markings to the book. This book is The Stark Munro Letters: Rose Premium Edition. Inscribed by Authors.

Hardcover in Slipcase. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: N/A. Spain Rodriguez (illustrator). 1st, limited. This book was produced in 3 versions, softcover, hardcover with DJ signed, and a deluxe slipcased edition, lettered with an original drawing. The one offered appears to be an artist proof copy, with a roman numeral instead of a letter. I believe there were around 10 of thee. It comes in the slipcase and is signed but does not have an original drawing and also lacks the dust jacket. From the artist's library.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. No Jacket. Mosley, Francis (illustrator). 1st Edition. First printing of the 1997 Folio Society edition. Illustrated by Francis Mosley and Introduced by Roger Lancelyn Green. SIGNED by the illustrator, Francis Mosley. A fine, bright, crisp copy ( no blemishes, no fading, no inscriptions - unread ) in a fine, fresh and unfaded slipcase. Paypal accepted. Signed by Illustrator(s).
